title: American_Top_40_1970_August_22nd_Complete
description:
"The biggest hits are yet to come as we count 'em down on American Top 40."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

As of this broadcast:

One singer in the countdown is set to release a four record LP album of 50 of his hit singles. Each one was a million seller.

Nine of the forty songs in this countdown are on the Motown label including the first white act for that label to put a song in the top ten.

One act in the countdown once had 6 gold records in an 18 month period and another had 12 gold records (singles and albums) in an 18 month period.

Casey remembers an artist whose had over 40 number one hits in his native country and kept at least one hit in the top ten every week for five consecutive years.

40: It's A Shame - The Spinners (Casey calls it "It's A Sham")
39: Westbound #9 - The Flaming Ember
38: Snowbird - Anne Murray
37: I'm Losing You - Rare Earth

OLDIE: California Dreamin' - The Mamas & The Papas
29: Big Yellow Taxi - The Neighborhood
